questions.question: In the deployment procedure, the N1 interface establishes a connection between which two entities?

explanations.a: Correct. N1 connects the User Equipment (UE) to the Access and Mobility Management Function (AMF).
explanations.b: Incorrect. This describes the N3 connection.
explanations.c: Incorrect. This describes the N10 connection.
explanations.d: Incorrect. This describes the N5 connection.

questions.question: The N2 interface represents the control plane connection between:

explanations.a: Incorrect. This is the air interface (Uu).
explanations.b: Correct. N2 is the NGAP interface between the RAN (gNB) and the Core (AMF).
explanations.c: Incorrect. This is the N3 User Plane interface.
explanations.d: Incorrect. This is the N11 interface.

questions.question: What is the primary function of the N3 interface shown in the simulation?

answers.b: To carry user plane data between gNB and UPF

explanations.a: Incorrect. Control plane is handled by N2/N1.
explanations.b: Correct. N3 is the user plane interface for data transfer.

questions.question: Which interface connects the Session Management Function (SMF) to the User Plane Function (UPF)?

explanations.b: Correct. N4 controls the UPF via the SMF.

questions.question: The N6 interface connects the User Plane Function (UPF) to which component?

explanations.a: Incorrect. Control NFs connect to the bus, but N6 is external.
explanations.b: Correct. N6 connects the 5G Core to external data networks.

questions.question: Which interface allows the Application Function (AF) to communicate with the Policy Control Function (PCF)?

explanations.a: Correct. N5 is the interface between AF and PCF.
explanations.b: Incorrect. N7 connects SMF and PCF.
explanations.c: Incorrect. N10 connects SMF and UDM.

questions.question: What role does the NRF (Network Repository Function) play when deployed in the simulation?

answers.b: It routes user data packets to the internet.
answers.c: It allows Network Functions to register and discover each other.

explanations.b: Incorrect. UPF handles user data routing.
explanations.c: Correct. NRF serves as a registry for NF discovery.

questions.question: Which interface connects the AMF to the UDM for subscription data retrieval?

explanations.a: Correct. N8 connects AMF to UDM.
explanations.b: Incorrect. N10 connects SMF to UDM.
explanations.c: Incorrect. N12 connects AMF to AUSF.
explanations.d: Incorrect. N13 connects AMF to UDM (and others) for discovery via NRF.

questions.question: Which feature allows for the immediate setup of the entire 5G Core topology without manual step-by-step selection?

explanations.a: Incorrect. Validate checks the existing topology.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Add Bus Line only adds the bus.
explanations.d: Correct. This button automates the entire deployment sequence.

questions.question: According to the procedure, which interface is deployed immediately after the N10 interface?

explanations.a: Correct. Step 10 is N11, which follows N10.
explanations.d: Incorrect. N13 is the last step.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'Validate' button in the toolbar?

answers.b: To verify that the topology is complete and correctly interconnected.
answers.c: To pay for the service subscription.

explanations.a: Incorrect. It checks topology, not performance.
explanations.b: Correct. It ensures all essential NFs and interfaces are present.
explanations.d: Incorrect. It does not stop the simulation.

questions.question: Which interface connects the AMF to the AUSF for authentication purposes?

explanations.d: Correct. N12 connects AMF to AUSF.

questions.question: How is the N11 interface (AMF-SMF) visually distinguished in the topology?

explanations.b: Correct. The simulation displays N11 as a dashed green line.

questions.question: Why do functions like AMF, SMF, and UDM all connect to the 'Service Bus'?

answers.a: To share the same power source.
answers.c: To directly route user video streams.
answers.d: Because they are in the same physical rack.

explanations.b: Correct. The bus represents the HTTP/REST signaling backbone of the SBA.
explanations.c: Incorrect. User plane data goes through UPF.

questions.question: Which interface connects the Session Management Function (SMF) to the Policy Control Function (PCF)?

explanations.a: Correct. N7 connects SMF and PCF for policy enforcement.
